ref: 8869 prastha2 m.n. ʻ a measure of weight or capacity = 32 palas ʼ MBh.
Pa. pattha -- m. ʻ a measure = 1/4 āḷhaka, cooking vessel containing 1 pattha ʼ;

lang: Language of `Kharoṣṭhī Inscriptions discovered by Sir Aurel Stein in Chinese Turkestan' edited by A. M. Boyer, E. J. Rapson, and E. Senart

ref: Pk. pattha -- , ˚aya -- m. ʻ a measure of grain ʼ;
K. path m. ʻ a measure of land requiring 1 trakh (= 9 1/2 lb.) of seed ʼ;
L. patth, (Ju.) path m. ʻ a measure of capacity = 4 boras ʼ;
Ku. pātho ʻ a measure = 2 seers ʼ;
N. pāthi ʻ a measure of capacity = 1/10 man ʼ;
Bi. pathiyā ʻ basket used by sower or for feeding cattle ʼ;
Mth. pāthā ʻ large milk pail ʼ, pathiyā ʻ basket used as feeding trough for animals ʼ;
H. pāthī f. ʻ measure of corn for a year ʼ;
Si. pata ʻ a measure of grain and liquids = 1/4 näliya ʼ.
